node.title: Businesses near Parliament struggling with protest on doorstep
node.description: Businesses near Parliament say they are only just holding on, with customers scared off by the massive group of protesters occupying the grounds.
node.content:
["Businesses near Parliament say they are only just holding on, with customers scared off by the massive group of protesters occupying the grounds.", "", "
Photo: RNZ / Angus Dreaver
", "Some bars and cafes near the precinct have already been forced to temporarily close their doors, while others have had customer numbers more than halve.", "There are now calls for the government to enter dialogue with the protesters in an attempt to break the deadlock and open the city back up.", "It is day seven of the noisy occupation of Parliament, and there are no signs people are going anywhere.", "There were at least 1000 people at the protest today, and the number of illegally parked vehicles blocking streets and tents on the grounds and in the surrounding areas increased.", "", "
Photo: RNZ / Hamish Cardwell
", "The Backbencher Pub is slap bang in the middle of it, forcing co-owner Alistair Boyce to shut its doors.", ""It's bloody hard, I don't know, like we're in real trouble - everyone is. Hospo businesses have only got weeks left, like seriously, it's just dire, we're on our knees."", "Boyce said the only way out of the deadlock was for the prime minister to meet with protesters to show she was listening.", "", "
Backbencher Pub co-owner Alistair Boyce. Photo: RNZ / Hamish Cardwell
", "A local business owner, who did not want to be named, said takings nose-dived since the protest started.", "She said most of the protesters were nice to her but she also feared for her safety at times. Some people became aggressive when she told them to wear a mask in her store.", ""We're a small business, we have to remain open, but at the same time I feel my health and my safety as well are at risk as well."", "She and other local business owners had told RNZ they government support to be able to survive the protest.", "Rae Julian, 80, lives in the Kate Sheppard Apartments, right in the thick of the occupation.", "Her age and asthma means she is immunocompromised.", ""And that's bothering me more because I don't have a car and therefore if I want to go anywhere I have to walk through the middle of them," she said.", ""I wear my mask, I'm not afraid of them and I have got into conversation with a number of them. It hasn't had much of a useful effect I should add, but I'm bothered because of Covid."", "", "
Nearly 81 year old resident of the Kate Sheppard apartments, Rae Julian, directly in front of the occupied grounds of Parliament Photo: RNZ / Hamish Cardwell
", "Julian is a former New Zealand Human Rights Commissioner and is no stranger to protests - having hit the streets just two weeks ago. But she said the protesters currently at Parliament were going too far.", ""They are breaking the law, they're infringing people's rights. I might want to protest again within the next few weeks, what is what they're doing, and getting away with, saying for other protests or issues. It's very important that we should have the right to protest but ... there are boundaries - and they're gone beyond those boundaries."", "Chris Roberts, who also lives at the Kate Sheppard apartments, said the protesters had taken over that part of town.", "He said he had to negotiate with the protesters to get his car in and out of the building over the weekend", ""We haven't seen anyone at any of the intersections around here controlling traffic. It's actually the protesters who are controlling traffic in the streets of Wellington right now."", "A number of large local employers including the nearby Victoria University Pipitea campus had also shut, and public transport was being diverted away from the area with the busy Molesworth street and side streets totally blocked by trucks, campervans and other vehicles.", "In an bid to ease the situation, the protesters were being given free parking at nearby Sky Stadium from 6.30pm.", "Michelle, a protester, doubted there would be a mass exodus of vehicles.", ""It's about all of New Zealand and if the shops on Molesworth Street and stuff have been affected, I don't think that's good so if they move their cars I think that's awesome. A lot probably won't, but I think a lot probably will."", "Time would tell whether the trucks and and vehicles moved away, but it did not look like the protest would end any time soon."]
